subclassFeature.name: Royal Bloodline
entries: Born with innate leadership, your charming abilities originate from your royal ancestors who served as kings and queens. Passed down to you in hopes of one day picking up the mantle to rule, your magic makes you a powerful speaker and a great commander in battle.

subclassFeature.name: Royal Spells
entries: Thanks to the service of your ancestors, different magics are granted to you in order to advise or lead allies in combat. You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Royal Spells table. The spells count as sorcerer spells to you, but they don't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know. These spells can't be replaced when you gain a level in this class.

entries.caption: Royal Spells
rows: {@spell aura of purity}, {@spell freedom of movement}
{@spell circle of power}, {@spell rary's telepathic bond|PHB|telepathic bond}

subclassFeature.name: Kingly Proficiencies
entries: When you choose this origin at 1st level, you gain proficiency with light armor, as your relatives fought alongside their knights. Also, you gain proficiency in both the {@skill Persuasion} and {@skill Intimidation} skills.

subclassFeature.name: Regal Remembrance
entries: Also at 1st level, you gain advantage on Intelligence ({@skill History}) checks to recall information about any kingdom or royal family thanks to your ancestor's past knowledge being encoded into your mind.

subclassFeature.name: Sovereign Empowerment
entries: Starting at 6th level, as a bonus action, you can choose to encourage one of your allies in battle. You can give a bonus to the next attack roll made by an ally of your choice that you can see within 60 feet of you. The bonus equals to 1 plus an abount of sorcery points you spend (maximum of +5 bonus). The target also gains a number of temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier. You must finish a short or long rest before you can target the same creature with this ability.

subclassFeature.name: Ancestral Aid
entries: At 14th level, your royal powers have grown immensely and thanks to it, you have been recognized by your ancestors who may now come to your aid at your command. As a bonus action, you mumble a few ancient words and bring forth the spirits of your ancestors. They appear as spectral humanoids that only you can see. While they are summoned, you and your allies within 30 feet of you gain a bonus to initiative rolls equal to your Charisma modifier. You may dismiss your ancestors as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Inspire the Leader
entries: Also starting at 14th level, whenever a creature affected by your {@i Sovereign Empowerment} ability scores a critical hit against a creature or rolls max damage on an attack, you regain 2 sorcery points.

subclassFeature.name: Mantle of Majesty
entries: At 18th level, a glowing rune symbolizing a sign of power (such as a crown, scepter, throne, etc.) appears in any part of your body. This rune represents your embrace and acceptance to the mantle of royalty. You are immune to the {@condition frightened} and {@condition charmed} conditions and all allies within 15 feet of you that can see and hear you have advantage on saving throws made to resist those conditions.

As an action, you can spend 4 sorcery points to create a bright, glowing ethereal crown that floats above your head, shedding bright light in a 30 foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Also, you and all allies within 30 feet of you gain a +2 bonus to their AC and their speed increases by 20 feet. This effect lasts for 1 minute, until you become {@condition incapacitated} or die, or until you dismiss it (no action required). When the ability ends, you gain a level of {@condition exhaustion}.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.
